Entries.default:
The Engoliero do Espirs pulses in your grip, thrumming with power. It rattles in its sheath, and for the first time in two hundred years, the blade is drawn free.

You wield the sword as your voice echoes across the ocean, eerily rising in volume rather than fading.
White fog, cold as the grave, churns up from the sea. It swells up and over the sides of [Player Ship] right as you hear the sound of a galleon approaching.

<link="stringtooltip://tooltips/2">"Io guri di prodeggere mat Paladina med Darcozzi i ouer iusti regli, mea Orelia Darcozzis eri.

"Guri chue liuretto bon aimo i ba fetta, eppore peri chue mao Dicenas fiaces mi converande."</link>

The groaning of centuries-rotted wood turns into the groaning of the undead. While the galleon flanks you, Lucia Rivan cuts you a look through the thick fog, her fleshless face lit by the flames burning in her hollowed eye sockets.
Then the Death Guard and her skeletal sailors are boarding your ship - coming for the sword. Coming for you.
